title: APT28
text: APT28 is a Russian cyber espionage group linked to the GRU's 85th Main Special Service Center. Active since at least 2004, APT28 has targeted political organizations, anti-doping agencies, nuclear facilities, and international organizations. Their operations have included hacking campaigns during the 2016 U.S. election and cyberattacks on critical infrastructure.

title: APT29
text: APT29 is a Russian cyber espionage group associated with the Russian Foreign Intelligence Service (SVR). It has targeted government, think tanks, and energy sectors globally using spearphishing and sophisticated malware campaigns.

title: Lazarus Group
text: Lazarus Group is a North Korean cyber threat group responsible for a wide range of cyber operations, including attacks on financial institutions, cryptocurrency exchanges, and global critical infrastructure.

title: Cobalt Group
text: Cobalt Group is a cybercrime group specializing in attacks on financial institutions, leveraging spearphishing and malware campaigns to conduct network intrusions and financial theft.

title: FIN7
text: FIN7 is a financially motivated cybercrime group that primarily targets the retail, restaurant, and hospitality sectors to steal payment card information through point-of-sale malware attacks.
